content: Why does Venus appear so bright in the sky?

Venus appears very bright in the sky because it is covered with thick clouds that reflect sunlight effectively. It is also relatively close to the Earth, making it one of the brightest objects in the sky after the Sun and the Moon. This is why it is commonly referred to as the Morning Star or the Evening Star.
What is the correct order of planets from the Sun?
The correct order of the planets from the Sun, in increasing distance, is: Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune.
